html: As Jehovah’s alienated people were beleaguered and laid low in the dust anciently, so they are laid low in his end-time Day of Judgment. For all who pertain to Isaiah’s Babylon category, Assyria’s invasion ends in destruction as it did in the past ( Isaiah 10:28-34; 21:1-2). Even the Zion/Jerusalem category undergoes Assyria’s siege until Jehovah has fully proven his people’s loyalty ( Isaiah 1:7-8; 31:4-5). The history of Jehovah’s ancient people and their demise are told for the benefit of his end-time people. Thevoice designates Jehovah’s servant, a seer ( Isaiah 28:16; 50:10) who tells their tale.
